intro: Topobea glaberrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf topobea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
